content.description: Climb the slot on the wall behind Top Rope Spire.
content.location: This is the bolted line in the gully behind Top Rope Spire.

content.description: This is a nice technical undertaking on good edges. A low crux on vertical terrain leads to easier slab climbing.
content.location: Start at the top of the gully to climber's right of the Top Rope Spire.

content.description: This is a fun, long route with varied movement. Plug in some gear down low if desired, and then follow the bolts to the chains.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear to 1" if desired, and chain anchors.
content.location: Start out of the right side of the gully on the right side of Top Rope Spire.

content.description: This looks low angle from the bottom and climbs on crumbly rock with lichen and other debris up to a decent 2 bolt anchor with quicklinks. There are a couple bulges that make for some tricky pulling but nothing that is super tough.
content.location: It is the very first route that you'll see after pulling off the road to park just before Company Wall (directly across the street from Graduation Boulder). Look up to your right, and that is the route. See the image for the view from the little pullout.

content.description: Start on a low angle slab, and follow bolts up a steep headwall.
content.protection: 4 bolts, small gear, and a chain anchor.
content.location: From the road, follow the climber's trail to the base of a short tower (Top Rope Spire), and then head left and uphill. This is the farthest left line at Company Wall.

content.description: Start with an easy jaunt up a slab. Moves into smaller holds along a slopey bulge. Continue up a face with small crimps towards the chickenhead. Mantel up over said chickenhead to a positive jug by the anchor!
content.protection: There are two bolts at the top without rap rings. Downclimb after cleaning the route.
content.location: It is located on the west side of the Toprope Spire. Climb up back side of Toprope Spire to the two bolts at the top. Set up a toprope, and rappel down or down climb.

content.description:
This shares a start with

Psychedelic Unicorn Pony

but veers right to climb a beautiful, detached arete.
content.protection: 4 bolts, gear to 1", and a 2 bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Cat Don't Piss on My Rope aka Cat Piss

content.description:
Climb a steep slab to the right of

Holy Hanger

.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Holy Hanger

and left of the prominent arete on the left side of Company Wall.

content.description: This has a good position on a prominent arete. The high first bolt can be easily attained by stepping onto the arete from the slab to the left.
content.location:
It is the obvious line on the arete between

Cat Piss

slab and the gully behind Top Rope Spire.
